definitions.definition: A specialized animal tissue with a high oil content, used for long-term storage of energy.
A refined substance chemically resembling the oils in animal fat.
That part of an organization deemed wasteful.
definitions.example: We need to trim the fat in this company

definitions.definition: An erection.
definitions.example: I saw Daniel crack a fat.

definitions.definition: A poorly played shot where the ball is struck by the top part of the club head. (see also thin, shank, toe)
The best or richest productions; the best part.
definitions.example: to live on the fat of the land

definitions.definition: Work containing much blank, or its equivalent, and therefore profitable to the compositor.
A fat person.
A beef cattle fattened for sale.
To make fat; to fatten.
To become fat; to fatten.
Carrying more fat than usual on one's body; plump; not lean or thin.
definitions.example: The fat man had trouble getting through the door.

definitions.definition: Thick.
definitions.example: The fat wallets of the men from the city brought joy to the peddlers.

definitions.definition: Bountiful.
Oily; greasy; unctuous; rich (said of food).
Exhibiting the qualities of a fat animal; coarse; heavy; gross; dull; stupid.
Fertile; productive.
definitions.example: a fat soil;  a fat pasture

definitions.definition: Rich; producing a large income; desirable.
definitions.example: a fat benefice;  a fat office;  a fat job

definitions.definition: Abounding in riches; affluent; fortunate.
Of a character which enables the compositor to make large wages; said of matter containing blank, cuts, or many leads, etc.
definitions.example: a fat take;  a fat page

definitions.definition: (originally African American Vernacular English) Excellent; cool; very good.
Sexy.
Rich in texture; prominent.
definitions.example: The song has a phat bass line.

definitions.definition: A large tub or vessel for water, wine, or other liquids; a cistern.
A dry measure, generally equal to nine bushels.
